website_summaries.verdict: You'll get the dependability and reliability of a more expensive hiking boot at an affordable price tag.
pros: This hiking boot stays solid on even the slipperiest footing with a rugged outsole that offers traction on just about any surface
cons: Sizing issues are a common complaint among some consumers

customer_reviews.title: So far GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 10.5-11, I got those in 12. Has a little more room but better for wearing thicker socks. Today did my first 2 hours hiking with them. No problems! No blisters. They look great too!
customer_reviews.author: Yanina M.

customer_reviews.title: The fit of this boot was really disappointing. I ...
customer_reviews.text: The fit of this boot was really disappointing. I took one step and was in total agony; the crease across the toe box cut into the top of my toes. Had to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but an issue for me...
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable if I were to just stand there. However, I tried walking around and every time I'm on the ball of foot in the back, the hard material on the outside of the boot bends inwards and ends up pushing down onto my toes. It wasn't too painful, but I could imagine it creating a rash or blister after miles of hiking. I usually wear size 7 and ordered a 7.5. Unfortunately I'm going to return, as I want something a bit softer and less stiff.
customer_reviews.author: joyce

customer_reviews.title: and these work great. When I first put them on
customer_reviews.text: Haven't taken any long hikes in these, but I walk 45 minutes daily (up and down hills, through fields and woods), and these work great. When I first put them on, it felt like there was too much room in the heels, but after walking in them, they're fine. They are lightweight, and have proven to be waterproof walking through wet, grassy fields. They fit true to size -- maybe even a little big -- they would work well with thick socks.
customer_reviews.author: JTD

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these because they were painfully narrow for me, I ordered my regular size 9.5. I did expect them to be stiff at first because they are full grain leather but after just a few hours of wearing them in the house my feet were hurting so bad I no desire to try & break them in outside. My pinkie toes actually felt like they were being pushed under my other toes. This was the first time I have tried Columbia footwear so I'm not sure if the run small or what but I'll stick to the brands I've worn in the past without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: SDNative

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots and am happy with the boot and ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots and am happy with the boot and how it fits BUT, it has a man- made upper. It is not real leather so buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Holm

customer_reviews.title: good afternoon
customer_reviews.text: this is to inform that since December 29, I made a request for a columbia boots and date and has not gotten me to contact them as Aryan
customer_reviews.author: yorvin berbeci

customer_reviews.title: The painful toe reviews are LEGIT. Huge DESIGN FLAW
customer_reviews.text: I took a risk and ordered these shoes because they appeared overwhelmingly positive. However, after taking ONE step in these boots around the house I noticed exactly what the other negative reviews mentioned: Each step you take, the top of the shoe creases as your foot bends, so the hard material on the top of the shoes hits the top of your foot each and every step. Wish I could give a better review, but unfortunately this makes them unwearable (and I really do not think that is something you could break in or change by wearing them). Had to return right after receiving.
customer_reviews.author: elena

customer_reviews.title: Blisters!
customer_reviews.text: I wore these boots on a 4 mile hike and after about 2 miles I could feel blisters forming. The crease in the toe box rubbed the skin away on my big toes. I also had some discomfort in my heels. I wore hiking socks and they seem to be the right size. I think the toe box crease is a problem with these boots. They are lightweight and look really nice on, but I don't want shoes that rub the skin off when I wear them.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hara

customer_reviews.title: Not for long hikes in Southern California
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots based on the great reviews here, and I was extremely disappointed. At first I was really happy, because the boots fit perfectly and were really comfortable right from the start. However, on my first hike in Joshua Tree NP the sole got very hot and rubber parts starting to peel off after just a couple of miles. The soles on both shoes got holes and cracks. I returned these boots since they broke on my first hike.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Haller

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit and good traction
customer_reviews.text: I love the fit of these, they’re super snug and comfy. I ordered a 9(I typically wear a 9.5 but they were out of stock at the time) and they fit pretty well so they may run a tad large. I read a couple reviews saying their toes were pinched while hiking in these but I took them with me for a weekend at Red River Gorge in KY and they were perfect. Now I wasn’t doing any crazy hiking, at most maybe ten miles total for a day and they held up really well. For the price, I’d definitely recommend these and I would absolutely purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute but weird at the toes..
customer_reviews.text: Not the worst boots ever, but the toe box bent in a weird way that I know would eventually rub my toes in a very uncomfortable way. There was a lot of extra room there too, but I won't rule out the fact my feet are weird. Super cute otherwise, just an awkward fit.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Hull

customer_reviews.title: Appropriate quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was very satisfied with these hiking boots. At first, when I just received them, the quality looked much worse then I expected, but later I was pleasantly surprised. I went hiking in Colorado for a week and wore them almost every day. Summited two mountains, with snow being about 3 feet deep, and the shoes stayed dry for the most part. Very comfortable sole and good ankle support.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasiya Melnichuk

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, comfortable boots for hiking or regular use
customer_reviews.text: These are the best shoes I've bought in a long time! I bought them for a backpacking trip 6 months ago and have worn them regularly through winter since then because they're waterproof. They were super comfortable backpacking 10 miles a day for a week, with minimal blisters by the end (for anyone who backpacks, that's pretty great). As for winter wear, they keep the snow out in Michigan, but aren't insulated, so require thicker wool socks on colder days. I prefer them to regular winter boots though because they're much more enjoyable to walk around in all day and my feet don't get too hot inside.
customer_reviews.author: thurst29

customer_reviews.title: didnt get past one step
customer_reviews.text: They seem to fit good, were true to size. but with one step I can feel the toe bending in and hitting my toes in the knuckle. Very uncomfortable, had to return immediately. see photo for the bend on the right one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love them! They are water proof and very reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have had these boots for 4 years and used them hiking all over the world. I love them! They are water proof and very reliable. Even though my boots are beat up at this point the tread remains good. I have worn these in all seasons, though they can get a little clunky when it's a hot summer. I will probably buy another pair when I finally have to retire my pair.
customer_reviews.author: M. W.

customer_reviews.title: I wore them up in the snow and like most reviews say
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a half size larger than usual, which was a mistake. These boots are VERY true to size and they were too big for me. I wore them up in the snow and like most reviews say, they're not waterproof. They don't have great traction, either. They'd be a great boot for most hikes, but not during wet/cold winter hikes. I also found them a bit heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Too tight on my big toe. Very uncomfortable. Will be returning these. Otherwise, I like the way they look and was really hoping they would fit (I have tried MANY brands and none seem to fit correctly) I ordered a size 7 wide and still too tight around the toe area.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable from the time I put them on, day one!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a 1/2 size larger per reviews and they fit well. I have a small bunion so the toe box area needs to be big enough to prevent pinching. These boots were great on fit, and were waterproof; I hiked through some snow and wet weather conditions. They were not real good on ice, no traction, but were amazing in every other way! Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: anna k burke

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots but the toe caps are separating from ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots but the toe caps are separating from the shoe which makes me sad. I would have rated these five starts for fit and looks if they didn't start to fall apart so soon.
customer_reviews.author: Sarahpilot

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were comfortable from the moment I put them on. There was no need to break them in. I bought them because I needed something waterproof, but I have a feeling I'll be wearing these more often than I thought I would when I bought them. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dona

customer_reviews.title: Great intro boots!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots the week before my first backpacking trip. They didn't need much breaking in and kept my feet completely dry during a muddy trip. They are slippery when wet, but nothing too terrible. I got my usual shoe size -- roomy enough for hiking socks with liners. I thought my feet would overheat without more ventilation, but they stayed cool during 85oF hiking. Overall, these are really solid boots. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: 88lackburn

customer_reviews.title: So sorry to have to return them...
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these boots and hated to return them. Loved the construction & look of the boot. Very comfortable - except for the toe crease that falls right across my big toe. I wore them inside for 30 minutes and had about convinced myself that I could live with it until I happened to step on a damp floor - and slipped. Since I was buying them to wear in Ohio in the winter, I decided to return them -- sadly.
customer_reviews.author: M Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Regret sizing up.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are gorgeous and incredibly lightweight, but I regret following others' advice and going up half a size. They ended up being slightly too roomy, so on intense hikes, the extra volume in the shoe caused my foot to shift around and for the ankle support to be compromised. Even with thick wool socks, I didn't feel as secure because of the room inside the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots! So comfy! Wore them at Bryce Canyon doing some hiking along with Zion. Great boots!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: I had to go up 1 1/2 sizes because of width
customer_reviews.text: I wear 8.5 Wide shoes and with these boots I had to go up to a size 10 in order for my toes not to feel scrunched. The size 10 with walking socks feel good.
customer_reviews.author: 21135shopper

customer_reviews.title: good grip in me
customer_reviews.text: I love this pair of hiking boots. It definitely has a good grip in me.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Dale

customer_reviews.title: nice and durable boots
customer_reviews.text: nice and durable boots. I just got back from a camping trip and am very happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: My feet fit comfortably and feel great even after a long day of ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these from another store. My previous pair finally went kaput. My feet fit comfortably and feel great even after a long day of hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

product_meta.title: Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Hiking Boot
product_meta.description:
A hiking boot designed with expert craftsmanship for the female hiking enthusiast, the Columbia Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof hiking boot is the ultimate companion for rigorous day out on the trail. High quality materials are first and foremost on Columbia's list of requirements when designing and creating women's footwear. These boots combine durability and comfort seamlessly while remaining lightweight and stylish.

Columbia's signature technology is what sets us apart, ensuring high-quality protection and prevention. This hiking boot features a waterproof mesh and leather exterior to protect from trail to mountain range. The advanced traction outsole works hard to tread grip in every environment to prevent slipping. Lastly, the signature lightweight midsole provides long-lasting comfort and superior cushioning for impact absorption and high energy return. 

Columbia offers our Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Boot in multiple colors and sizes. To ensure the size you choose is right, please utilize our sizing chart. 



Columbia offers a wide variety of outdoor performance footwear, outerwear, sportswear, and accessories. Columbia products are engineered using the best technologies and highest quality materials, providing you with innovative products that are functional yet stylish and a great value.
feature_bullets: ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY: Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Hiking Boot features our lightweight, durable midsole for long lasting comfort, superior cushioning, and high energy return as well as an advanced traction rubber sole for slip-free movement on rough ground.

HANDY FEATURES: Treacherous days out on the trail are comfortable and worry-free with this boot's waterproof full-grain leather and mesh bootie construction and its durable mesh tongue for breathability.
ADJUSTABLE FEATURES: The Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Hiking Boot features a lace-up closure for an adjustable, secure fit.
FEMININE STYLE: This women's waterproof hiking boot delivers style and durability with its contrasting color combinations and soft mesh exterior. Midsole is Techlite EVA

OMNI-GRIP: This multi-terrain traction system matches specially formulated compounds and treads to specific environments. A dual-zone winter tread pattern ensures solid footing on surfaces such as ice and snow.
